result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco Mitchell Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $100.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco Mitchell Gonzalez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:53 PM: Defendant Marco Mitchell Gonzalez in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel and is prepared to resolve matter today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (POT):  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  ADA argues for Court Costs as SEH.  No statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Imposes Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample to be provided by the end of  today.  Appeal Rights Given.    Expungement process as to DNA record explained to Defendant.
